intro: Megalastrum polybotryoides, commonly known as the golden star hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow-orange flowers that resemble stars, which bloom throughout the year. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and a woody stem that can grow up to several meters in height. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
